item.title: Elon Musk to buy TikTok from China, here’s what the company has to say - The Times of India
item.description:
Elon Musk to Buy TikTok from China: Here’s What the Company Has to Say

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here], Source: [Insert Source Here]

Elon Musk's potential acquisition of TikTok has sparked significant interest, with the company responding to inquiries about the deal.

  • Musk is reportedly interested in acquiring TikTok to bolster his influence in social media.
  • Concerns have been raised regarding data privacy and national security implications of such a purchase.
  • The company emphasizes its commitment to user trust and data protection.
"We are focused on maintaining the integrity and safety of our user base across all platforms." - TikTok Representative

This acquisition could have far-reaching implications in the tech industry and social media landscape.

item.title: Apple iPhone sales drop 5% globally after AI rollout disappoints, Chinese competition grows - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Apple's global iPhone sales declined by about 5% globally during the final quarter of 2024, due to underwhelming upgrades and rising Chinese competition

Publication Date: January 14, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

In the final quarter of 2024, Apple Inc. saw a 5% drop in global iPhone sales, attributed to disappointing upgrades and increasing competition from Chinese brands.

  • Global iPhone sales dropped by 5% and 2% for the entire year while the industry grew by 4%.
  • Apple's market share fell to 18%, with Chinese competitors like Xiaomi and Vivo gaining ground.
  • Chinese smartphone vendors achieved record shipments, accounting for 56% of the global market.
  • Apple’s AI features lag behind competitors, particularly in China, Apple’s major market outside the US and Europe.
“This past quarter was particularly remarkable for the largest Chinese smartphone vendors,” said IDC analyst Francisco Jeronimo.

Although Apple’s overall sales were down, there was a noted increase in the sales of higher-end iPhone models in China, representing over half of its shipments there.

item.title: ‘Chinese delay’ make Apple and Foxconn seek government help - The Times of India
item.description:
Chinese Delay Forces Apple and Foxconn to Request Government Assistance

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Apple and Foxconn are seeking help from the government due to delays attributed to China.

  • Chinese manufacturing delays are impacting production schedules for Apple and Foxconn.
  • Both companies are exploring government assistance to mitigate the situation.

The ongoing situation highlights the vulnerabilities in global supply chains, especially in tech manufacturing.

item.title: Vishal Mega Mart shares emerge as a Mutual Fund favourite post listing - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Vishal Mega Mart Shares Become a Favorite Among Mutual Funds Post-Listing

Publication Date: Jan 14, 2025 8:44 AM IST

Source: CNBC TV18

Newly listed Vishal Mega Mart Ltd. has attracted considerable interest from India's domestic mutual funds, reflected in its shareholding pattern.

  • Domestic Mutual Funds own an 8.66% stake in Vishal Mega Mart.
  • Nippon India AMC has a 3.08% stake in the company.
  • Aditya Birla Sun Life Mutual Fund purchased shares worth ₹250 crore.
  • Axis Mutual Fund bought shares worth ₹380 crore.
  • Total retail investor stake stands at 4.52%, with 9.13 lakh retail shareholders.
  • The stock closed 4% lower at ₹104 but trades above its IPO price of ₹79.
“Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPIs) held a 6.47% stake as of December, with the Government of Singapore notably holding 1.67%.”

Vishal Mega Mart's listing has seen strong support from mutual funds, showcasing investor confidence in the company.

item.description:
'Recognise efforts rather than misinterpret them': L&T HR head defends chairman’s 90-hour workweek remark

Publication Date: [Date Not Provided] Source: [Source Not Provided]

The HR head of L&T has defended the chairman's recent remark regarding his 90-hour workweek, emphasizing the importance of recognizing efforts rather than misinterpretations.

  • The chairman received backlash for discussing his long working hours.
  • The HR head highlighted the need for a fair understanding of employee dedication.
  • The conversation touches on work-life balance concerns in modern workplaces.
“It is crucial to appreciate the commitment individuals show without misinterpretations.”

This article sheds light on the ongoing discussion around work hours and employee recognition in the corporate world.

item.title: China discusses sale of TikTok US to Elon Musk as one possible option - The Times of India
item.description:
China discusses sale of TikTok US to Elon Musk as one possible option

Date: October 2023

Source: Unknown

China is reportedly considering the option of selling TikTok's US operations to Elon Musk amid ongoing concerns about data privacy and security.

  • The discussions arise as tensions between the U.S. and China escalate over technology and trade.
  • Elon Musk's interest in acquiring TikTok could reshape the social media landscape.
  • This potential sale is framed within broader efforts to address regulatory scrutiny facing TikTok.
“The sale could provide a new path forward for TikTok amid regulatory challenges in the U.S.”

This potential sale is a significant development in the ongoing saga of data privacy and tech company regulations, with implications for users and the market.

item.description:

item.title: ITC Hotels shares credited to Demat accounts after allotment; ITC investors get THIS special message - ET Now
item.description:
ITC Hotels Shares Credited to Investors' Demat Accounts After Allotment

Updated: January 14, 2025 - Source: ET NOW

ITC Hotels shares have been credited to the Demat accounts of eligible ITC shareholders following the allotment announced on January 11, with shares credited on January 13.

  • Eligible shareholders received an SMS confirming the credit of ITC Hotels shares to their accounts.
  • A total of 125.11 crore equity shares have been allotted to ITC shareholders based on their holdings as of January 6.
  • The shares carry no value at the moment and are currently represented as a dummy ticker in Demat accounts.
  • ITC Hotels shares will be listed on NSE and BSE, with trading set to start after the listing.
  • Shares will be included in Nifty 50 and BSE Sensex as a dummy ticker before their official listing.
"Consequent to the above, ITCHL has ceased to be a subsidiary of the Company effective 11th January, 2025," ITC stated.

In conclusion, ITC Hotels shares are now available in shareholders' Demat accounts, ready for future trading post-listing.

item.title: China considering TikTok US sale to Elon Musk if company fails to fend off potential ban: Report - Hindustan Times
item.description:
China Considering Selling TikTok to Elon Musk Amid U.S. Ban Threat

Date: January 14, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

China is contemplating selling TikTok's U.S. operations to Elon Musk if the company fails to prevent a proposed ban by U.S. authorities.

  • The Chinese officials prefer TikTok to remain with parent company ByteDance.
  • A potential ban on TikTok is expected as President-elect Trump assumes office, raising national security concerns.
  • Musk, a supporter of Trump, has been appointed co-chair of the Department of Government Efficiency.
  • ByteDance is contesting the impending ban in the U.S. Supreme Court, which has set a deadline of January 19 for a sale.
  • About half of the U.S. population uses TikTok, which has raised data privacy concerns among lawmakers.
  • A sale to Musk might align TikTok's operations more closely with his management style of Twitter, now rebranded as “X.”
TikTok is used by roughly half of the US population, catering to around 170 million users.

The situation surrounding TikTok continues to evolve, with significant implications for its future in the U.S. market.

item.title: Indian stock market: 7 key things that changed for market overnight - Gift Nifty, CPI inflation to HCL Tech Q3 Results | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Indian stock market: 7 key things that changed for market overnight - Gift Nifty, CPI inflation to HCL Tech Q3 Results

Publication Date: Unknown Source: Live Mint

The domestic equity market indices, Sensex and Nifty 50, are expected to open higher on Tuesday amid mixed global cues, following a significant crash on Monday.

  • On Monday, the Sensex and Nifty suffered substantial declines of 1.36% and 1.47%, respectively.
  • Rising crude oil prices, a depreciating rupee, and foreign capital outflows were primary contributors to the sell-off.
  • Asian markets showed a mixed response, with Japan's Nikkei down while South Korea's Kospi rose.
  • The Gift Nifty suggests a gap-up start, trading at around 23,280.
  • HCL Technologies reported an 8.4% QoQ increase in net profit for Q3, showing strong performance amidst market fluctuations.
  • Retail inflation in India eased to a four-month low at 5.22%, which may ease concerns for rate cuts from the RBI.
  • Strong direct tax collection growth indicates robust economic activity despite market volatility.
“Wide-spread selling across the sectors fuelled along with massive exits in mid and small-cap stocks further worsened the sentiment.” - Prashanth Tapse, Senior VP (Research), Mehta Equities Ltd.

This market turbulence reflects ongoing global trends and highlights the complexities of the current economic landscape, as various factors are contributing to the risk and resilience of the Indian stock market.

item.title: GIFT Nifty up 150 points; here's the trading setup for today's session - The Economic Times
item.description:
GIFT Nifty up 150 points; here's the trading setup for today's session

Publication Date: Today
Source: Economic Times

Indian markets experienced a sell-off due to strong US payroll data, leading to expectations of volatility. The GIFT Nifty indicates a gap-up start for Dalal Street.

Key factors influencing the market include the upcoming 2025 budget, Q3 results, RBI policy, and global political events.

  • GIFT Nifty traded up by 152.50 points, indicating a positive start.
  • India VIX rose 7.2% to 16 levels, reflecting increased market fear.
  • Foreign portfolio investors were net sellers, while domestic institutional investors bought shares worth Rs 8,066 crore.
  • The rupee declined sharply, hitting a historic low of 86.62 against the US dollar.
“Any pullback up to 23,350 could be a sell-on-rise opportunity.” - Nagaraj Shetti, HDFC Securities

The market is expected to remain volatile as key economic and political factors unfold.

item.title: China's export curbs: Hi-tech machinery supply faces major hit - The Economic Times
item.description:
China's Export Curbs: Hi-Tech Machinery Supply Faces Major Hit

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Economic Times

China's tightening of export regulations is dramatically affecting sectors reliant on hi-tech machinery, particularly in electronics and electric vehicles, with industry leaders warning of severe manufacturing setbacks in India.

  • China has almost halted exports of critical industrial machinery needed for production.
  • Firms like Foxconn, BYD, and Lenovo face challenges in scaling up operations in India.
  • The Indian government is considering measures to mitigate the impact on manufacturing.
  • The restrictions are seen as a protectionist move by Beijing amid geopolitical tensions.
  • India's domestic manufacturing ecosystem is underdeveloped compared to other countries such as Vietnam.
“The Chinese government is stopping capital equipment exports from China which are critical to the manufacturing of various products, especially electronics, EVs and solar panels.” - Anonymous executive

China's export restrictions could hurt evolving manufacturing ecosystems in India, compelling the government to rethink strategies to support domestic industries reliant on Chinese machinery.

item.title: Retail inflation dips to 4-month low of 5.2% in Dec - The Times of India
item.description:
Retail inflation dips to 4-month low of 5.2% in Dec

Date: Data not provided Source: Times of India

The retail inflation rate in India has dropped to its lowest level in four months, settling at 5.2% for December. This significant decrease is attributed to lower prices in various sectors.

  • The inflation rate is a key indicator of the economic health, affecting monetary policy and purchasing power.
  • This is the lowest inflation rate reported since August of the previous year.
  • Factors contributing to this decline include decreased food prices and stabilizing crude oil prices.
"This decline in inflation is a positive sign for economic recovery as it provides more room for policy adjustments." - Economic Analyst

This decrease in retail inflation signals potential economic stability, providing hope for consumers and policymakers alike.

item.title: DMart Shares Tank 6% As Q3 Earnings Fail To Impress D-Street; Should You Invest? - News18
item.description:
DMart Shares Tank 6% As Q3 Earnings Fail To Impress D-Street; Should You Invest?

Date: January 13, 2025 | Source: News18

Avenue Supermarts, the operator of the DMart retail chain, reported disappointing Q3 results leading to a significant drop in share prices. Investors are left questioning whether to buy, sell, or hold.

  • Avenue Supermarts shares fell by 5.7%, reaching Rs 3,474.
  • Q3FY25 revenue increased by 17.5% YoY, totaling Rs 15,565 crore.
  • Net profit rose 6.5% YoY to Rs 785 crore, but margins are under pressure.
  • EBITDA margin dropped to 7.9% from 8.5% YoY.
  • Same-store sales growth was reported at 8.3%.
  • The company will focus on both home delivery and pick-up services.
  • Analysts have adjusted their earnings projections downwards and have mixed ratings on DMart’s stock.
  • Management changes announced with a new CEO effective March 15, 2025.
“While discounting in the FMCG category remained intense, the impact on high-turnover stores in metro towns was lower than in the previous quarter.” - Neville Noronha, CEO

Investors are advised to closely monitor the company’s strategic changes and market performance amidst competitive pressures.

item.title: India's retail inflation eases to 4-month low of 5.22% in December 2024 | Dec is 4th month with retail inflation over 5% | Inshorts - Inshorts
item.description:
Heavy Rainfall and Very Dense Fog Warnings Issued for Several States

Date: Monday 13 January, 2025 | Source: Inshorts

The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued warnings for heavy rainfall and dense fog affecting multiple states in India. These warnings are particularly significant for the coming day.

  • Heavy rainfall is expected over Tamil Nadu and Puducherry.
  • Very dense fog warnings are issued for Punjab, Haryana, Chandigarh and Uttar Pradesh.
  • Dense fog is also likely over additional states including Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand, and West Bengal among others.
IMD warns that conditions may lead to travel disruptions and safety concerns due to low visibility.

These weather conditions highlight the ongoing impact of the winter season in India, requiring public awareness and preparedness.

item.title: Stock market crash: Investors lose ₹25 lakh crore in four days of slump - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Stock market crash: Investors lose ₹25 lakh crore in four days of slump

Date: Jan 13, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Investments worth nearly ₹25 lakh crore in market valuation have been lost in the past four days of a severe drubbing in the equity market.

  • The market capitalisation of BSE-listed firms dropped to ₹4,17,05,906.74 crore ($4.82 trillion), a fall of ₹24,69,243.3 crore.
  • On Monday alone, investors' wealth dropped ₹12.61 lakh crore.
  • Continued foreign institutional investor selling crossed ₹20,000 crore this month, contributing to negative sentiments.
  • The Indian rupee touched a fresh low against the dollar during the session.
  • Oil prices reached their highest level in over three months due to expanded US sanctions disrupting Russian crude supplies.
  • Over the previous four sessions, BSE Sensex has tanked 1,869.1 points (2.39%).
  • 3,562 stocks declined, while 555 advanced and 131 remained unchanged on the BSE.
  • 508 stocks registered their 52-week lows.
“Continued foreign institutional investor selling crossed ₹20,000 crore this month, contributing to the negative sentiments.” - Siddhartha Khemka, Head - Research, Wealth Management, Motilal Oswal Financial Services Ltd.

This stock market slump highlights the growing concerns among investors and the impact of global economic factors on local markets.

item.title: Tether Announces it Will Relocate to El Salvador - Watcher Guru
item.description:
Tether Announces it Will Relocate to El Salvador

Date: January 13, 2025

Source: Watcher.Guru

Tether has announced its official relocation to El Salvador, highlighting the country as a “beacon of freedom.” This move follows the company obtaining a Digital Asset Service Provider license.

  • Tether's CEO, Paulo Ardoino, confirmed the relocation via social media.
  • The company is set to foster global Bitcoin adoption through this move.
  • El Salvador has been recognized for its forward-thinking market in the crypto landscape.
“This strategic positioning is helping to shape the future of financial systems, making the country a key player in the global fintech landscape.”

This relocation marks a significant step for Tether and could signal a trend for further crypto industry migration to pro-crypto nations.

item.title: Stocks to Watch on January 14: HCLTech, JSW Energy, Adani Energy Solutions, Quess Corp and more - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Stocks to Watch on January 14: HCLTech, JSW Energy, Adani Energy Solutions, Quess Corp and more

Date: January 14, 2025 Source: CNBC TV18

This article discusses the key stocks to monitor on January 14, highlighting recent performance updates from companies like HCLTech and JSW Energy.

  • HCLTech: Reported a 5.54% growth in net profit to ₹4,591 crore for the December quarter.
  • JSW Energy: Declared the successful applicant for the resolution plan for KSK Mahanadi Power Company Ltd.
  • Adani Energy Solutions: Transmission network expanded to 26,485 circuit kilometres, up 29.7% YoY.
  • Quess Corp: Received an income tax refund order for ₹20.74 crore.
  • Angel One: Reported an 8.1% YoY increase in net profit at ₹281.4 crore for the December quarter.
  • Delta Corp: Net profit rose 3.5% YoY to ₹35.7 crore.
  • Anand Rathi Wealth: Net profit increased by 33.3% YoY to ₹77.3 crore.
  • DEN Networks: Reported a 14.6% decline in net profit at ₹40.3 crore.
“The company’s transmission network expanded to 26,485 circuit kilometres (ckm), a 29.7% increase from the previous year’s 20,422 ckm.”

This summary outlines important updates from various stocks that investors should keep an eye on as trading continues to unfold on January 14.

item.title: Sensex Crashes 1,100 Points, Investors Lose Over Rs 14 Lakh Crore; Why Is Market Falling? - News18
item.description:
Sensex Crashes 1,100 Points, Investors Lose Over Rs 14 Lakh Crore; Why Is Market Falling?

Date: January 14, 2025 | Source: News18

Indian equity indices, BSE Sensex and Nifty50, experienced a severe drop in the market, affecting investor sentiment due to several underlying economic factors.

  • BSE Sensex fell by more than 1,100 points, reaching a low of 76,250.
  • Nifty50 lost 350 points, sliding to 23,047.
  • Market capitalization of BSE-listed companies declined by Rs 14.54 lakh crore.
  • The US jobs report indicated strong employment growth, impacting expectations for Federal Reserve rate cuts.
  • Persistent foreign selling was noted, with FPIs offloading equities worth over Rs 21,350 crore in January.
  • Global crude oil prices surged due to geopolitical tensions, straining India's fiscal health.
  • The Indian rupee hit an all-time low of Rs 86.27 against the US dollar.
  • Analysts project downgrades in corporate earnings growth.
“Markets are under pressure due to multiple headwinds. The strong US jobs data has reduced expectations of rate cuts by the Fed in 2025,” said VK Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist at Geojit Financial Services.

In conclusion, the market's significant fall illustrates the interconnected nature of global economic data and the impacts on local markets. Investors are advised to stay informed about these dynamics.
